translated: At the beginning, the earth-supporting element, the self-existent one, held the earth, just at the time of the protection of the world.

analyzed: nārāyaṇaḥ khila guruḥ guru kola deham tena ahanat diti sutam daśana agra ghātaiḥ
translated: Narayana, the preceptor of all, with a body of a guru-kola, struck the son of Diti with the tips of his teeth.

original: bhūmer adho dharaṇimaṇḍalam aprameyaḥ śeṣākhya āsa jagataḥ sthitaye nitāntam /
analyzed: bhūmeḥ adhas dharaṇi maṇḍalam aprameyaḥ śeṣa ākhyaḥ āsa jagataḥ sthitaye nitāntam
translated: Under the earth, the immeasurable one named Shesha, for the sake of the stability of the world, always remained.

original: yasmin kalārpitam idaṃ likhivac cakāsti nāgādhipair munigaṇaiḥ parisevitāṅghriḥ // /
analyzed: yasmin kalā arpitam idam likhi vat cakāsti nāga adhipaiḥ muni gaṇaiḥ parisevita aṅghriḥ
translated: On whom this universe is placed as if written, and whose feet are served by the lords of serpents and groups of sages.

original: tasmād adhaḥ kamaṭha āsa viśālarūpī brahmāṇḍabhāṇḍaparivistṛtādivyakāyaḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt adhas kamaṭhaḥ āsa viśāla rūpī brahmāṇḍa bhāṇḍa parivistṛtā divya kāyaḥ
translated: Below him, Kamatha, of a vast form, with a divine body extending throughout the universe,

original: śeṣo 'pi yatra paribhāti sutantutulyo yaṃ cāryamā pitṛpatiḥ samupāsate vai // /
analyzed: śeṣaḥ u pi yatra paribhāti su tantu tulyaḥ yam ca aryamā pitṛ patiḥ samupāsate vai
translated: Where Shesha also shines like an excellent thread, and where Aryama, the lord of the ancestors, worships.

original: dṛṣṭvā dṛśārdhavayasāpi vihāya mātur dehaṃ dhruvaṃ madhuvane tapasābhitaptam /
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā dṛśā ardha vayasā api vihāya mātuḥ deham dhruvam madhuvane tapasā abhitaptam
translated: Having seen that, even with half a glance, abandoning the body of his mother, he will certainly torment himself with austerities in the Madhu forest.

original: bhūtvā kṛpāmayavapur bhagavān svalokaṃ prādāt stuvanti yatayo munayo 'pi yaṃ vai // /
analyzed: bhūtvā kṛpā maya vapuḥ bhagavān sva lokam prādāt stuvanti yatayaḥ munayaḥ yam vai
translated: Having become a body full of compassion, the Blessed One gave his own world to them, and even the ascetics and sages praise him.

original: ālokya kardamatapo bhagavān vibhūtyai saṃśuddhadivyavapuṣāvirabhūt saśuklaḥ /🔽tasmā adād varamajātmajaputrarūpam ānandabindupayasā ca cakāra tīrtham // /
analyzed: ālokya kardama tapaḥ bhagavān vibhūtyai saṃśuddha divya vapuṣā āvirabhūt sa śuklaḥ  tasmai adāt varam aja ātmaja putra rūpam ānanda bindu payasā ca cakāra tīrtham
translated: Seeing the impurity of austerities, the Blessed One, with a pure divine form, appeared white for prosperity.🔽To him, he gave the boon of the form of the son of the daughter of Manu, unborn, and with the water of the drop of bliss, he made a holy place.

original: yajñe sa eva rucinā manuputriputra āhūtisūtir asurāraṇivahnikalpaḥ /
analyzed: yajñe saḥ eva rucinā manu putri putraḥ āhūti sūtiḥ asura araṇi vahni kalpaḥ
translated: In the sacrifice, he himself, the son of the daughter of Manu, like the sacrificial fire for the demons, was invoked by the one with desire, the giver of oblations.

original: trailokyagopanavidhau suranātha īśa nāmnā suyajña iti viśrutakīrtir āśiḥ // /
analyzed: trailokya gopana vidhau sura nāthaḥ īśa nāmnā suyajñaḥ iti viśruta kīrtiḥ āśiḥ
translated: In the arrangement for the protection of the three worlds, the lord of the gods, by the name of Suyajna, with fame and blessings well-known.

original: siddheśvaraś ca samabhūt kapilākhya īśaḥ śrīdevahūtitanayo vitatāna tasyai /
analyzed: siddheśvaraḥ ca samabhūt kapila ākhyaḥ īśaḥ śrī devahūti tanayaḥ vitatāna tasyai
translated: And the lord named Kapila became the lord of the Siddhas. The son of Devahuti, he spread for her

original: yogaṃ svaśaktisahitaṃ cidacidvibhāgaṃ sāṃkhyaṃ tathā svabhimukheṣu jagāda śuddham // /
analyzed: yogam sva śakti sahitam cit acit vibhāgam sāṃkhyam tathā su abhimukheṣu jagāda śuddham
translated: the yoga along with his own power, the division of consciousness and unconsciousness, and the pure sankhya he spoke to his own followers.

original: yogeśvaro 'tritanayo bhagavān ananto dattākhya āsa samatāvavadat svacaryām /
analyzed: tri tanayaḥ bhagavān anantaḥ datta ākhyaḥ āsa sva caryām
translated: The lord of yoga, the son of Atri, the infinite one, known as Dattatreya, lived in equality and spoke of his own conduct.

original: prahlādahaihayayaduṣv aparāyaṇeṣu śiṣyeṣu śikṣitakathāṃ kathayan gurubhyaḥ // /
analyzed: prahlāda haihaya yaduṣu aparāyaṇeṣu śiṣyeṣu śikṣita kathām kathayan gurubhyaḥ
translated: To Prahlada, Haihaya, and Yadudhi, who had no other refuge, to the disciples who had learned the stories from the teachers, he spoke.

original: nārāyaṇo nara ṛṣipravarāvabhūtāṃ dharmasya dakṣaduhitary adhimūrtipatnyām /
analyzed: nārāyaṇaḥ naraḥ ṛṣi pravarau abhūtām dharmasya dakṣa duhitari adhimūrti patnyām
translated: Narayana and Nara became the foremost of sages, born of the wife of Dharma, the daughter of Daksha, who was the embodiment of his highest form.

analyzed: dhīra upakāra karuṇa āśaya kāya śuddham tīvram tapaḥ pracaratām surarāja tāpam
translated: The wise one, with a pure body of compassion to help others, practiced intense austerities, tormenting the king of the gods.

original: nābher abhūd ṛṣabhasaṃjñasadāptakāmo yogeśvaraḥ sutaśatair avadat prajābhyaḥ /
analyzed: nābheḥ abhūt ṛṣabha saṃjña sat āpta kāmaḥ yoga īśvaraḥ suta śataiḥ avadat prajābhyaḥ
translated: From the navel, the one with the name Rishbhu, the best of lovers, the lord of yoga, was born. He spoke to the people about the hundred sons.

original: dharmaṃ tataḥ paramayogijanāvacaryāṃ naiṣkarmyalakṣaṇaparāṃ svayam ācacāra // /
analyzed: dharmam tatas parama yogi jana avacaryām naiṣkarmya lakṣaṇa parām svayam ācacāra
translated: He practiced the dharma that is the conduct of the highest yogis, which is characterized by non-action, himself.

original: dhātrantike susanakādibhir īryamāṇe cetoguṇān vigalituṃ bhagavān sa haṃsaḥ /
analyzed: dhātṛ antike su sanaka ādibhiḥ īryamāṇe cetaḥ guṇān vigalitum bhagavān sa haṃsaḥ
translated: When the world was being protected by Sanaka and others near the nurse, the Blessed One, the Swan,

original: provāca tattvam amalaṃ sadayārdracittā yasmād guṇāguṇavibhāgam abhūn munīnām // /
analyzed: provāca tattvam amalam sa dayā ārdra cittā yasmāt guṇa aguṇa vibhāgam abhūt munīnām
translated: spoke the pure truth with a heart moist with compassion, from which the division of qualities and faults of the sages arose.

original: vene mṛte dvijajanair anu bāhuyugmaṃ saṃmathyamānasamaye pṛthurūpa āsīt /
analyzed: vene mṛte dvija janaiḥ anu bāhu yugmam saṃmathyamāna samaye pṛthu rūpaḥ āsīt
translated: When Vena died, his arms were churned by the Brahmins, and at that time, Prithu appeared.

original: lokakṣudhāṃ praśamayan pṛthivīṃ dudoha sarvāṇi bhūtikaraṇāni ca sarvabhūtyai // /
analyzed: loka kṣudhām praśamayan pṛthivīm dudoha sarvāṇi bhūti karaṇāni ca sarva bhūtyai
translated: Satisfying the hunger of the people, he milked the earth and all the means of sustenance for the welfare of all beings.

original: dakṣasya yajñavihite śivaśaktihetoḥ prāptājyabhāmam adhikaṃ bhṛguṇābhidattam /
analyzed: dakṣasya yajña vihite śiva śakti hetoḥ prāpta ājya bhāmam adhikam bhṛguṇā abhidattam
translated: For the sake of Shiva's power in Daksha's sacrificial rites, the excess of the oblation was given to Bhrigu by the one who obtained it.

original: tatrāṣṭabāhur abhavad bhagavān bhavāya prāptā nutiḥ suranarādikṛtāpi tena // /
analyzed: tatra aṣṭa bāhuḥ abhavat bhagavān bhavāya prāptā nutiḥ sura nara ādi kṛtā api tena
translated: There, the Blessed One became eight-armed, and even though praise was offered by gods, humans, and others for his existence, he did not accept it.

original: jātaḥ priyavratakule gaya ity udārakīrtiṃ tatāna bhagavān tanuvāṅmanobhiḥ /
analyzed: jātaḥ priyavrata kule gayaḥ iti udāra kīrtim tatāna bhagavān tanu vāc manobhiḥ
translated: He was born in the family of Priyavrata, and the illustrious one spread his fame with his body, speech, and mind.

original: tenāpi yajñatanur īśvara indrarūpī spardhāṃ cakāra mahatāṃ madam ādadhānaḥ // /
analyzed: tena api yajña tanuḥ īśvaraḥ indra rūpī spardhām cakāra mahatām madam ādadhānaḥ
translated: Even by him, the Lord in the form of Indra, having a sacrificial body, engaged in rivalry, causing pride in the great ones.

original: saṃvatsarasya tanayaḥ sa ha yāminīnām ālokanādivividhaṃ mudam ācikīrṣuḥ /
analyzed: saṃvatsarasya tanayaḥ sa ha yāminīnām ālokana ādi vividham mudam ācikīrṣuḥ
translated: He, the son of the year, desiring to proclaim the various joys of seeing the nights,

original: śrīkāmadevavapuṣā hy avatīrya devo devyomayā madanakelibhir ārarāma // /
analyzed: śrī kāmadeva vapuṣā hi avatīrya devaḥ devyā umayā madana kelibhiḥ ārarāma
translated: the Lord, having descended in the form of Kamadeva, sported with the Goddess Uma through amorous pastimes.

original: prācīnabarhitanayāṃs tapasā sutaptān dṛṣṭvā svaśāntavapuṣāvirabhūd anantaḥ /
analyzed: prācīna barhi tanayān tapasā su taptān dṛṣṭvā sva śānta vapuṣā āvirabhūt anantaḥ
translated: Seeing the sons of Prachinavarhi well-heated through austerities, the infinite one appeared with his peaceful form.

original: dattvā svapādabhajanaṃ vasatāṃ gṛheṣu kanyāṃ ca vṛkṣajanitām adiśad dayāluḥ // /🔽svārociṣe tuṣitayā dvijavedaśīrṣāj jāto vibhuḥ sakaladharmabhṛtāṃ variṣṭhaḥ /
analyzed: dattvā sva pāda bhajanam vasatām gṛheṣu kanyām ca vṛkṣa janitām adiśat dayāluḥ  svārociṣe tuṣitayā dvija veda śīrṣāt jātaḥ vibhuḥ sakala dharma bhṛtām variṣṭhaḥ
translated: Having given them the service of his feet while they lived in his house, the compassionate one directed them to the daughter born from the tree.🔽In the Svārociṣa manvantara, the Lord, the best of all who uphold dharma, was born from the head of the Veda of the twice-born, along with Tuṣitā.

original: yad brahmacaryāniyamān ṛṣayo 'py aśikṣan sākṣāj jagadgurutayāvacacāra śuddhān // /
analyzed: yat brahmacarya aniyamān ṛṣayaḥ api aśikṣan sākṣāt jagadguru tayā avacacāra śuddhān
translated: The sages learned the rules of celibacy from him, and he himself practiced pure conduct as the teacher of the world.

original: dharmād abhūt sutatayā bhagavāṃs tṛtīye manvantare trijagataḥ sthitaye kṛpāluḥ /
analyzed: dharmāt abhūt suta tayā bhagavān tṛtīye manvantare trijagataḥ sthitaye kṛpāluḥ
translated: In the third Manvantara, the merciful Lord, known as Satyasena, was born for the sake of the three worlds.

original: śrīsatyasena iti durjanayakṣarakṣān yas tān apāharad asau suranāthamitraḥ // /
analyzed: śrī satyasenaḥ iti durjana yakṣa rakṣān yaḥ tān apāharat asau sura nātha mitraḥ
translated: He, the friend of the Lord of the gods, removed those wicked Yakshas and Rakshasas.

original: turye 'ntare sarasi vāraṇarājarājaṃ grāheṇa tīvrabalinā parikarṣayantam /
analyzed: turye ntare sarasi vāraṇa rājarājam grāheṇa tīvra balinā parikarṣayantam
translated: In the fourth Manvantara, in a lake, the king of elephants was being dragged by a powerful crocodile.

original: nārāyaṇety abhihite harir uddadhāra tasmād bhavārṇavajalād api devarājaḥ // /
analyzed: nārāyaṇa iti abhihite hariḥ uddadhāra tasmāt bhava arṇava jalāt api devarājaḥ
translated: When he was called Narayana, Vishnu lifted him out of the water of the ocean of existence, even the king of the gods.

original: vaikuṇṭha āsa bhagavān dvijavarya mudrā devyā mayā tadanurūpajayābhidhānaḥ /
analyzed: vaikuṇṭhaḥ āsa bhagavān dvija varya mudrā devyāḥ mayā tad anurūpa jaya abhidhānaḥ
translated: O best of Brahmins, the Lord was in Vaikuntha, with the goddess Lakshmi, known as Jayanti, who is suitable for him.

original: vaikuṇṭhadarśanam akārayad aprameyas tasyāu pañcamamanoḥ samaye prasiddham // /
analyzed: vaikuṇṭha darśanam akārayat aprameyaḥ pañcama manoḥ samaye prasiddham
translated: The immeasurable one caused the vision of Vaikuntha to be seen, at the time of the fifth Manu, it is well known.

original: ṣaṣṭhe 'ntare tu bhagavān dvijaśāpakhinnadehān surān avanatān avalokya sannaḥ /🔽vairājavipratanayo 'jitasaṃjña īśo devāsurair amathayat sahasā payodhim // /
analyzed: ṣaṣṭhe ntare tu bhagavān dvija śāpa khinna dehān surān avanatān avalokya sannaḥ  vairāja vipra tanayaḥ jita saṃjñaḥ īśaḥ deva asuraiḥ amathayat sahasā payodhim
translated: In the sixth Manvantara, the Lord, seeing the gods bowing down, their bodies pained by the curse of the Brahmins, was distressed.🔽The Lord, the son of the Brahmin Viraja, known as Ajita, suddenly churned the ocean with the gods and demons.

original: devāsure jalanidher mathanād viṣaṣṇe hastāc cyute girivare sahasārdracittaḥ /
analyzed: devāsure jalanidheḥ mathanāt viṣaṣṇe hastāt cyute giri vare sahasā ārdra cittaḥ
translated: When poison appeared from the churning of the ocean in the battle of the gods and demons, the best of mountains suddenly fell from Vishnu's hand, with a wet heart.

original: bhūtvā tu kūrmavapur adbhutam uddadhāra mene ca parvatavivartanagātrakaṇḍūm // /🔽dugdhāmbudhāv ururujāṃ pracikīrṣur īśa ādāya pūrṇakalaśaṃ sudhayā nitāntam /
analyzed: bhūtvā tu kūrma vapuḥ adbhutam uddadhāra mene ca parvata vivartana gātra kaṇḍūm  dugdha ambudhau uru rujām pracikīrṣuḥ īśaḥ ādāya pūrṇa kalaśam sudhayā nitāntam
translated: Assuming the wonderful form of a tortoise, he supported the earth and felt the itch of churning the mountain with his body.🔽Desiring to bestow long life on the people, the Lord, in the form of Dhanvantari, emerged from the milky ocean with a full pot of nectar.

original: āyurvidhānanigamaṃ khalu yajñabhoktā dhanvantariḥ samabhavad bhagavān narāṇām // /
analyzed: āyuḥ vidhāna nigamam khalu yajñabhoktā dhanvantariḥ samabhavat bhagavān narāṇām
translated: The Blessed Lord Dhanvantari, the enjoyer of sacrifices, became the physician of men, the one who knows the science of life.

original: dhanvantarer amṛtapūrṇaghaṭe svavārā cūrṇīyamāna amare śaraṇaṃ praviṣṭe /
analyzed: dhanvantareḥ amṛta pūrṇa ghaṭe sva vārā cūrṇīyamāna amare śaraṇam praviṣṭe
translated: When Dhanvantari, holding a full pot of nectar, entered the refuge of the immortals, being ground to powder by the demons,

original: mohiny abhūt sa bhagavān asurāsurāṇāṃ mohāya tāpaviramāya sadāptakāmaḥ // /🔽satyavratāya janatarpaṇataḥ svarūpaṃ mātsyaṃ mahākaruṇayā pravitatya sadyaḥ /
analyzed: mohinī abhūt sa bhagavān asura asurāṇām mohāya tāpa viramāya sat āpta kāmaḥ  satyavratāya jana tarpaṇataḥ sva rūpam mātsyam mahā karuṇayā pravitatya sadyas
translated: The Blessed One, who is the cause of delusion to the demons and gods, who is free from distress, and who has attained all desires, became Mohini.🔽Out of compassion for Satyavrata, who was engaged in satisfying the people, the Lord, assuming the form of a fish, immediately spread out his form.

original: kalpārṇave 'py avadad acyuta ātmatattvaṃ bhūrūpanāvivasate viharan dvijebhyaḥ // /
analyzed: kalpa arṇave pi avadat acyutaḥ ātma tattvam viharan dvijebhyaḥ
translated: In the ocean of the great deluge, the imperishable Lord, moving about in the form of a fish, taught the truth about the self to the Brahmins.

original: trailokyaduḥkhadalanāya nṛsiṃharūpaṃ kṛtvā svabhaktam avituṃ kila lāṅgalāgraiḥ /
analyzed: trailokya duḥkha dalanāya nṛsiṃha rūpam kṛtvā sva bhaktam avitum kila lāṅgala agraiḥ
translated: Assuming the form of Narasimha for the destruction of the suffering of the three worlds, in order to protect his devotee, with the tips of his claws,

analyzed: dhṛtvā asura indram asura indra viśāla tīvra vakṣaḥ sthalam sthalam iva agra nakhaiḥ dadāra
translated: Holding the demon king, with a chest wide and fierce like the king of demons, he tore him apart with his sharp front claws.

original: yasmin prapaśyati baliḥ sagaṇaṃ trilokaṃ tenāpi vāmanatanuṃ bhagavān gṛhītvā /
analyzed: yasmin prapaśyati baliḥ sa gaṇam trilokam tena api vāmana tanum bhagavān gṛhītvā
translated: In which Bali saw the three worlds along with his followers, the Blessed One also took on the form of a dwarf.

original: saṃyācya sammitapadatritayaṃ baleḥ svaṃ kṛtvā triviṣṭapam adād aditeḥ sutebhyaḥ // /
analyzed: saṃyācya sammita pada tritayam baleḥ svam kṛtvā triviṣṭapam adāt aditeḥ sutebhyaḥ  /
translated: Having begged from Bali three steps of land, he made heaven his own and gave it to the sons of Aditi.

original: bhaktān ahaṃ samanuvarta iti svavācaṃ sākṣāt prakartum iva bhūvivare praviṣṭaḥ /
analyzed: bhaktān aham samanuvarte iti sva vācam sākṣāt prakartum iva bhū vivare praviṣṭaḥ
translated: As if to make his own words come true, I follow my devotees, he entered the earth's cavity.

original: vairocaner gṛham arakṣayad aprameyo nāmnā gadādhara iti kṣapayan dayāvān // /
analyzed: vairocaneḥ gṛham arakṣayat aprameyaḥ nāmnā gadādharaḥ iti kṣapayan dayāvān
translated: The immeasurable one, destroying the house of Virochana, became known as Gadadhara, the merciful one.

original: bhūtvā tu bhārgavakule nijatātanāśād rāmo mahāparaśukaṃ parigṛhya tīkṣṇam /
analyzed: bhūtvā tu bhārgava kule nija tāta nāśāt rāmaḥ mahā paraśukam parigṛhya tīkṣṇam
translated: Having taken birth in the Bhargava family due to the death of his father, Rama took up the great sharp axe.

original: kṣatraṃ nivārya kṣititalaṃ parihṛtya bhūyo dattvā dvijāya hy avasat sa mahendrapṛṣṭhe // /
analyzed: kṣatram nivārya kṣiti talam parihṛtya bhūyas dattvā dvijāya hi avasat sa mahendra pṛṣṭhe
translated: Having destroyed the Kshatriyas and again giving the earth to the Brahmins, he dwelt on the peak of Mahendra.

analyzed: vṛndārakaiḥ pariniṣevita pāda padmaḥ śrī rāmacandraḥ iti sūrya kula abdhi jātaḥ
translated: His lotus feet served by the Vrishnis, he who was born in the ocean of the solar dynasty, known as Sri Ramachandra.

original: devārināśanavidhau kuśikānvayena nīto maheśadhanur ājagavaṃ babhañja // /
analyzed: deva ari nāśana vidhau kuśika anvayena nītaḥ maheśa dhanuḥ ājagavam babhañja  /
translated: In the rite of destroying the enemies of the gods, he was brought by the descendant of the Kushika lineage and broke the Ajagava bow of Mahesha.

original: jñātvā tato bhṛgukulodbhavadhīravīraṃ rāmaṃ sugaurarucirāṃ pariṇīya sītām /
analyzed: jñātvā tatas bhṛgu kula udbhava dhīra vīram rāmam su gaura rucirām pariṇīya sītām
translated: Then, knowing that Rama, the brave one born in the Bhrigu lineage, had married Sita, who was beautiful with a fair complexion,

original: gatvā gṛhān gṛhapateḥ pitur āptajāyāvācaṃ niśamya vanavāsam agāt sabhāryaḥ // /
analyzed: gatvā gṛhān gṛhapateḥ pituḥ āpta jāyā vācam niśamya vana vāsam agāt sa bhāryaḥ
translated: he went to his father's house, the house of the householder. Hearing the words of his wife, he went to live in the forest with his wife.

original: tīrtvā gāṅgapayo 'nujānugamanāc chrīcitrakūṭaṃ giriṃ tyaktvā duṣṭavirādharādhadamano dhāvan dhanur dhārayan /
analyzed: tīrtvā gāṅga payaḥ nuja anugamanāt śrī citrakūṭam girim tyaktvā duṣṭa virādha rādha damanaḥ dhāvan dhanuḥ dhārayan
translated: Having crossed the Ganges water, following his younger brother, he went to the Shri Chitrakut mountain, leaving behind the destroyer of the wicked Viratha, holding a bow.

original: hatvā krūrasurendravairihariṇaṃ mārīcasaṃjñaṃ tato laṅkeśāhṛtasītayā khalu punaḥ prāpto dṛśām īdṛśām // /
analyzed: hatvā krūra sura indra vairi hariṇam mārīca saṃjñam tatas laṅkeśa āhṛta sītayā khalu punar prāptaḥ dṛśām īdṛśām
translated: Having killed the cruel demon king's deer named Maricha, who was brought by the lord of Lanka, he was seen again by Sita, with eyes like this.

original: candraṃ caṇḍakaraṃ pracaṇḍapavanaṃ mene sumandānilaṃ mālāṃ mālatimallikāṃ śucikalāṃ gītaṃ sphuliṅgāyitam /
analyzed: candram caṇḍakaram pracaṇḍa pavanam mene su manda anilam mālām mālati mallikām śuci kalām gītam
translated: He considered the moon with fierce rays, the fierce wind very slow, the garland of jasmine flowers with pure beauty, the singing like sparks.

original: ity evaṃ vanitāparāyaṇanaraṃ hāsyann ivālokayan ṛkṣaṃ manmathasāyakāhṛtamano reme priyāśaṅkayā // /
analyzed: iti evam vanitā parāyaṇa naram hāsyan iva ālokayan ṛkṣam manmatha sāyaka āhṛta manaḥ reme priyā śaṅkayā
translated: Thus, looking as if laughing at the man devoted to women, the bear, with his mind taken away by the arrows of Cupid, enjoyed with the suspicion of his beloved.

original: gatvā vānararājavālinamahāmitreṇa setuṃ tato baddhvā vāridhim ātarat taratamaṃ sākaṃ plavaṃgair mudā /
analyzed: gatvā vānara rāja vālina mahā mitreṇa setum tatas baddhvā vāridhim ātarat taratamam sākam plavaṃgaiḥ mudā
translated: Having gone and built a bridge with the great friend of the king of monkeys, he crossed the ocean with the monkeys, with great joy.

original: chittvā rākṣasayakṣalakṣam amalā sītā saputrānujaṃ laṅkeśaṃ jvaladagninā bhagavatā cāptā punaḥ sā purī // /
analyzed: chittvā rākṣasa yakṣa lakṣam amalā sītā sa putra anujam laṅkeśam jvalat agninā bhagavatā ca āptā punar sā purī
translated: Having killed a lakh of demons and yakshas, Sita was purified, and with the blazing fire, the lord obtained the city again, along with her sons and younger brother, the lord of Lanka.

analyzed: sūrya ādi śaktim a vihṛtya śaśāsa bhūmim go vipra prājña parisevana sarva dharmaḥ
translated: Without deviating from the power of the sun and others, he ruled the earth, devoted to all duties of serving cows, Brahmins and the wise.

original: udriktabhaktinamitān anayat svanāthān sarvān vanādhivasataḥ svapadaṃ suśāntam // /
analyzed: udrikta bhakti namitān anayat sva nāthān sarvān vana adhivasataḥ sva padam su śāntam  /
translated: He brought all his own lords, who were bent down with excessive devotion, from the forest dwelling to his own very peaceful position.

original: tasyānujo bharatasaṃjña udārabuddhī rāmājñayā nijagṛhe nivasann api śrīm /
analyzed: tasya anujaḥ bharata saṃjñaḥ udāra buddhiḥ rāma ājñayā nija gṛhe nivasan api śrīm
translated: His younger brother, of great intelligence, known as Bharata, though dwelling in his own house by Rama's command,

original: tyaktvā vanasthavratavān abhavat tato vai gandharvakoṭimathanaṃ viharaṃś cakāra // /
analyzed: tyaktvā vanastha vratavān abhavat tatas vai gandharva koṭi mathanam viharan cakāra  /
translated: abandoned his prosperity and took up the vow of living in the forest. Then, sporting with the millions of gandharvas, he acted.

original: śrīlakṣmaṇas tadavaro vanam etya rāmaṃ sītāṃ niṣecya bahukaṣṭa āsīt /
analyzed: śrī lakṣmaṇaḥ tad avaraḥ vanam etya rāmam sītām niṣecya bahu kaṣṭaḥ āsīt
translated: Sri Lakshmana, his younger brother, having come to the forest and consecrated Rama and Sita, remained in great hardship.

original: bāhye 'pi cāsya vacasā vanam etya dehaṃ saṃtyajya tatpadam agād arisainyavahniḥ // /
analyzed: bāhye ca asya vacasā vanam etya deham saṃtyajya tat padam agāt ari sainya vahniḥ
translated: And even though he was outside, by his word, having come to the forest, the enemy army fire abandoned his body and went to his feet.

original: śatrughnasaṃjña uruvikramaśuddhabuddhiḥ śauryeṇa darpadalano dviṣatāṃ dayāluḥ /
analyzed: śatrughna saṃjñaḥ uru vikrama śuddha buddhiḥ śauryeṇa darpa dalanaḥ dviṣatām dayāluḥ
translated: The one known as Shatrughna, of vast prowess, pure intellect, in valor, the crusher of pride in enemies, compassionate,

original: dīneṣu daityalavaṇāntaka āryasevī svānyeṣu sāmyamatirājanatābhirāmaḥ // /🔽mārkaṇḍanāmamunaye bhuvanāni deṣṭuṃ māyālaye tanutare jaṭhare mukundaḥ /
analyzed: dīneṣu daitya lavaṇa antakaḥ ārya sevī sva anyeṣu sāmya matiḥ āja nata abhirāmaḥ  mārkaṇḍa nāma munaye bhuvanāni deṣṭum māyā ālaye tanutare jaṭhare mukundaḥ
translated: The destroyer of the demon Lavaṇa, serving the noble ones, impartial towards his own and others, charming to the people.🔽Mukunda, the immeasurable child, lay in the very small womb of Māyā, in the leaf-cup of a fig tree, engaged in sucking his thumb,

original: nyagrodhapattrapuṭakośaśayāna āsīd aṅguṣṭhapānaparamaḥ śiśur aprameyaḥ // /🔽vṛtrasya ghoravapuṣā paritāpitānāṃ saṃrakṣaṇāya bhagavān yudhi nirjarāṇām /
analyzed: nyagrodha pattra puṭa kośa śayānaḥ āsīt aṅguṣṭha pāna paramaḥ śiśuḥ aprameyaḥ  vṛtrasya ghora vapuṣā paritāpitānām saṃrakṣaṇāya bhagavān yudhi nirjarāṇām
translated: in order to show the worlds to the sage named Mārkaṇḍa.🔽The illustrious one, whose fame is sung by Garuḍa and Kinnaras, became the first, of the nature to destroy the great sorrow, fear and grief

original: ādyo hy abhūd garuḍakiṃnaragītakīrtis teṣāṃ suduḥkhabhayaśokavināśaśīlaḥ // /
analyzed: ādyaḥ hi abhūt garuḍa kiṃnara gīta kīrtiḥ teṣām su duḥkha bhaya śoka vināśa śīlaḥ
translated: of the gods who were tormented by the terrible form of Vṛtra, for their protection in the battle.

original: aṅguṣṭhaparvasumitān śramaṇān dvijāgryān dṛṣṭvā tu goṣpadapayogatasarvadehān /
analyzed: aṅguṣṭha parva su mitān śramaṇān dvijāgryān dṛṣṭvā tu goṣpada payaḥ gata sarva dehān
translated: Seeing the foremost of the twice-born, the ascetics, whose bodies were all reduced to the size of a cow's hoof, by the power of their thumb,

original: brahmaṇya indrahasitān samidaṃśuhastān gurvarcanāya kṛpayāvad amūn prapannān // /
analyzed: brahmaṇyaḥ indra hasitān samidh aṃśu hastān guru arcanāya kṛpayā avat amūn prapannān  /
translated: the lord of Brahmā, with a smile of Indra, with hands holding the rays of the sacrificial fuel, he compassionately approached them to honor the guru.

original: duṣyantabījam adhigamya śakuntalāyāṃ jāto hy ajo 'pi bhagavān adhiyajñakart /
analyzed: duṣyanta bījam adhigamya śakuntalāyām jātaḥ hi ajaḥ bhagavān adhiyajña kart
translated: The unborn lord, the performer of sacrifices, was born from the seed of Dushyanta in Shakuntala.

original: vismāpayan bahunṛpān bahuvājimedhān sākṣād iyāja bahu dānam adād ameyaḥ // /
analyzed: vismāpayan bahu nṛpān bahu vājimedhān sākṣāt iyāja bahu dānam adāt ameyaḥ
translated: Amazed many kings, many horse sacrifices, he actually performed many sacrifices and gave innumerable gifts.

original: sarvān janān kaliyuge balabuddhihīnān dṛṣṭvā kṛpāparavaśo vasuvīryajāyām /
analyzed: sarvān janān kali yuge bala buddhi hīnān dṛṣṭvā kṛpā paravaśaḥ vasuvīryajāyām
translated: Seeing all people in the Kali age devoid of strength and intellect, he, overcome by compassion, was born from the womb of Vasudeva's wife.

original: jātaḥ parāśarasakāśata ādidevo vedān samāhitatayā vibhajiṣyati sma // /
analyzed: jātaḥ parāśara sakāśataḥ ādidevaḥ vedān samāhita tayā vibhajiṣyati sma
translated: The primordial god, born from Parashara, will divide the Vedas with a concentrated mind.

original: vṛṣṇeḥ kule tu bhagavān baladevanāmā yasmād balān atibalān adalat surārīn /
analyzed: vṛṣṇeḥ kule tu bhagavān baladeva nāmā yasmāt balān atibalān adalat surārīn
translated: In the Vrishni clan, the Lord named Balarama, from whom the enemies of the gods, stronger than the strong, were destroyed.

original: yal lāṅgalāgrakalanāt kururājadhānī dhāneva dhāmasahitā calitātibhītā // /
analyzed: yat lāṅgala agra kalanāt kuru rājadhānī dhānā iva dhāma sahitā calitā ati bhītā
translated: By the tip of his plough, the capital of the Kuru king, along with its wealth, trembled in great fear, as if it were the earth itself.

original: bhūmer janasya nijapādaparāyaṇasya vṛṣṇer ajo 'pi bhagavān sukham ādadhānaḥ /
analyzed: bhūmeḥ janasya nija pāda parāyaṇasya vṛṣṇeḥ ajaḥ pi bhagavān sukham ādadhānaḥ
translated: For the earth and people devoted to his feet, the unborn Lord also brought happiness to the Vrishnis.

original: jāto bhaviṣyati yaśo vipulaṃ prakartuṃ śrīkṛṣṇa ity abhihito 'khilaśaktipūrṇaḥ // /
analyzed: jātaḥ bhaviṣyati yaśaḥ vipulam prakartum śrī kṛṣṇaḥ iti khila śakti pūrṇaḥ
translated: He will be born to spread great fame, called Krishna, full of all powers.

original: jāto nijena vapuṣā vasudevagehe gatvā tu gokulam atho viharan vinodaiḥ /
analyzed: jātaḥ nijena vapuṣā vasudeva gehe gatvā tu gokulam atho viharan vinodaiḥ
translated: Born in the house of Vasudeva in his own form, then going to Gokula, he will play with amusements.

analyzed: bāla ākṛtiḥ viśada bālaka bhāṣā hāsaiḥ go gopa gopa vanitā mudam āśu kartā
translated: With the form of a child, with the laughter and speech of a clear child, he will quickly delight the cowherds, cowherds, and cowherd women.

analyzed: kaṃsa anuśiṣṭa sura śatru gaṇān ulūkī mukhyān haniṣyati vraja sthitaye mahā adrim
translated: He will kill the hosts of enemies of the gods, instructed by Kamsa, headed by Uluka, for the welfare of Vraja, the great mountain.

original: dhṛtvocchilīndhram iva sapta dināni vāmahaste pragṛhya suranāthamadaṃ pramārṣṭā // /
analyzed: dhṛtvā ucchilīndhram iva sapta dināni vāma haste pragṛhya sura nātha madam pramārṣṭā
translated: He will kill the hosts of enemies of the gods, instructed by Kamsa, with the chief of the owls, for the sake of the people of Vraja, holding a great mountain in his left hand for seven days, like a bunch of basil flowers, and wiping away the pride of the lord of the gods.

original: dhātrā yadā sapaśugopaśiśau praṇīte buddher bhramo halabhṛto 'bhavad aprameyaḥ /
analyzed: dhātrā yadā sa paśu gopa śiśau praṇīte buddheḥ bhramaḥ halabhṛtaḥ bhavat aprameyaḥ
translated: When the creator, the immeasurable one, the bearer of the plough, was brought as a child with cattle and cowherds, there was a delusion of the intellect,

original: tat saṃharan sapaśupālakulasvarūpaṃ kṛtvā vidhiṃ vividhamohamalāt sa dhartā // /
analyzed: tat saṃharan sa paśupāla kula sva rūpam kṛtvā vidhim vividha moha malāt sa dhartā  /
translated: removing that, taking the form of a cowherd with the cowherds, the upholder will perform the ritual, free from various impurities of delusion.

analyzed: vṛndāvane surabhi vādya vilāsa gītaiḥ godhuk vadhū jana manoja javam dadhānaḥ
translated: In Vrndavana, with the sweet sounds of music and singing, possessing the speed of the minds of the cowherd men and women,

analyzed: kartā mahā madana keli vihāra goṣṭhī vismāpanam niśi niśācara khecarāṇām
translated: he will perform the rite of astonishing the night-walkers and sky-walkers with the great sport of amorous pastimes at night.

original: kaṃsasya raṅgasadanaṃ sabale praṇīte svāphalkinā bhavadhanus tarasā vibhajya /
analyzed: kaṃsasya raṅga sadanam sa bale praṇīte svāphalkinā bhava dhanuḥ tarasā vibhajya
translated: When he is brought to Kamsa's arena with his army by the son of Svaphalka, quickly breaking the bow of Bhava,

original: cāṇūraśūraśamanaṃ sahakaṃsamājau kartā dvipaṃ kuvalayaṃ sahasā nihatya // /
analyzed: cāṇūra śūra śamanam saha kaṃsam ājau kartā dvipam kuvalayam sahasā nihatya
translated: he will kill the elephant Kuvalaya and the wrestlers Chanura and Shura in the arena with Kamsa.

original: sāṃdīpanaṃ mṛtasutaṃ gurudakṣiṇārthī dattvā jarāsutabalaṃ yavanaṃ ca hatvā /
analyzed: sāṃdīpanam mṛta sutam guru dakṣiṇā arthī dattvā jarā suta balam yavanam ca hatvā
translated: In order to give a guru-dakshina, he will kill the son of Jarasandha and the Yavana, giving Sandipani's dead son back to life,

original: śrīrukmiṇīprabhṛtidāraśataṃ vivāhya tābhyaḥ sutān daśadaśānu janiṣyati sma // /🔽bhaumaṃ nihatya sagaṇaṃ divi devamātur dātuṃ tadīyamaṇikuṇḍalam ādidevaḥ /
analyzed: śrī rukmiṇī prabhṛti dāra śatam vivāhya tābhyaḥ sutān daśa daśa anu janiṣyati sma  bhaumam nihatya sa gaṇam divi devamātuḥ dātum tadīya maṇi kuṇḍalam ādidevaḥ
translated: He will marry a hundred wives, headed by Rukmini, and will beget ten sons from each of them.🔽The primordial god, having killed the earthly demon with his followers, will go to heaven to give the jeweled earrings to the mother of the gods.

original: gatvā surendratarurājavaraṃ priyāyāḥ prītau samuddharaṇato ditijān sa jetā // /🔽bāṇāsurasya samare mama vīryanāśāl labdhāmaratvam adhikaṃ yudhi bhūpabandhūn /
analyzed: gatvā surendra taru rāja varam priyāyāḥ prītau samuddharaṇataḥ ditijān sa jetā  bāṇa asurasya samare mama vīrya nāśāt labdha amara tvam adhikam yudhi bhūpa bandhūn
translated: Having gone to the best of celestial trees, he will rescue the demons in order to delight his beloved. He, the conqueror, will be victorious.🔽Having regained his immortality in battle by destroying the demon Bana's prowess, he will conquer the kings and their allies in battle.

original: jitvā yudhiṣṭhiranṛpakratunā vivāhabījaṃ nipātya gurubhārataraṃ prahartā // /🔽loke pradarśya sutarāṃ dvijadevapūjāṃ svasyāpy apārakaruṇāṃ nijasevakebhyaḥ /
analyzed: jitvā yudhiṣṭhira nṛpa kratunā vivāha bījam nipātya guru bhārataram prahartā  / loke pradarśya sutarām dvijadeva pūjām svasya api apāra karuṇām nija sevakebhyaḥ
translated: Having performed the marriage ceremony with King Yudhishthira's sacrifice, he will strike down the heavy burden of his elders.🔽Having shown in the world the worship of Brahmanas and gods, and his own boundless compassion towards his own servants,

original: trātvā parīkṣitanṛpaṃ paramāstradagdhaṃ pārthāya bhūtim avalokayitā dvijārthe // /
analyzed: trātvā parīkṣita nṛpam parama astra dagdham pārthāya bhūtim avalokayitā dvija arthe  /
translated: he will protect King Parikshit, burned by the supreme weapon, and will look on for the sake of the Brahmanas, the prosperity of Arjuna's son.

original: kāmena snehabhayarāgakuṭubasaṃdhe yasmin mano nivasataḥ śamalaṃ nirasya /
analyzed: kāmena sneha bhaya rāga kuṭuba saṃdhe yasmin manaḥ nivasataḥ śamalam nirasya
translated: In which, the mind, free from impurities, resides, bound by love, fear and affection, due to desire,

original: dātā svarūpam amalaṃ pariśuddhabhāvaḥ sākṣāt svarūpaniratasya ca kiṃ nu vakṣye // /
analyzed: dātā sva rūpam amalam pariśuddha bhāvaḥ sākṣāt sva rūpa niratasya ca kim nu vakṣye
translated: The giver is of pure form, of pure nature. What shall I say of him who is devoted to his own form?

original: yat pādapaṅkajaparāgaparāyaṇānām agre cakāsti na ca muktisukhaṃ nitāntam /
analyzed: yat pāda paṅkaja parāga parāyaṇānām agre cakāsti na ca mukti sukham nitāntam
translated: That which shines before those who are devoted to the pollen of his lotus feet, and is not at all the bliss of liberation,

original: kiṃ vānyadarpitabhayaṃ khalu kālavegaiḥ sākṣān mahāsukhasamudragatāntarāṇām // /
analyzed: kim vā anya darpita bhayam khalu kāla vegaiḥ sākṣāt mahā sukha samudra gata antarāṇām
translated: Or what else, indeed, is the fear of being carried away by the speed of time for those whose inner being is immersed in the great ocean of bliss?

original: gaṅgāditīrthatapahomavratādikebhyaḥ kīrtiṃ svakīyam adhikāṃ samudīrya loke /
analyzed: gaṅgā ādi tīrtha tapa homa vrata ādikebhyaḥ kīrtim svakīyam adhikām samudīrya loke
translated: Having proclaimed his own fame in the world as superior to the Ganges, holy places, austerities, sacrifices, vows, and so on,

original: atyunnataṃ dvijakulaṃ dvijaśāpavyājād dhatvā svalokam amalaṃ tanunābhigantā // /🔽tasmād bhaviṣyati sutaḥ sukhado janānāṃ pradyumnasaṃjña urugāyaguṇānurūpaḥ // /
analyzed: ati unnatam dvija kulam dvija śāpa vyājāt hatvā sva lokam amalam tanunā abhigantā  tasmāt bhaviṣyati sutaḥ sukha daḥ janānām pradyumna saṃjñaḥ urugāya guṇa anurūpaḥ
translated: He will kill the excessively proud brahmin clan under the pretext of a brahmin's curse and go to his own pure world with his body.🔽Therefore, a son will be born who will bring happiness to people, named Pradyumna, equal in qualities to Vishnu.

original: kartā mudaṃ muditavaktrasucārugātraiḥ pātrair ivāmṛtapayo manujān pracchan /
analyzed: kartā mudam mudita vaktra su cāru gātraiḥ pātraiḥ iva amṛta payaḥ manujān pracchan
translated: He will bring joy to humans with his beautiful face and body, like a vessel filled with nectar and milk.

analyzed: tatra api ajaḥ pravartaka tayā manasi īśvaraḥ pi
translated: There, a younger brother named Aniruddha will be born, the lord of the mind, who will propagate the names.

original: yasmād uṣāharaṇato bhujavīryanāśād bāṇo bhaviṣyati śivānugaśāntadehaḥ /
analyzed: yasmāt uṣā haraṇataḥ bhuja vīrya nāśāt bāṇaḥ bhaviṣyati śiva anuga śānta dehaḥ
translated: Because of the destruction of his arm strength in abducting Usha, Bana will become one whose body is peaceful, following Shiva.

original: vyāsād bhaviṣyati / / / ṇeichenjh bhagavān araṇyāṃ yogī janān prati gadiṣyati vedasāram // /
analyzed: vyāsāt bhaviṣyati bhagavān araṇyām yogī janān prati gadiṣyati veda sāram
translated: The Blessed One, a yogi in the forest, will speak to the people the essence of the Vedas.

original: śrīmatsuśāntam amalaṃ bhagavatpraṇītaṃ yac chraddhayā kalijanā api yānti śāntim /🔽buddhāvatāram adhigamya kalāvalakṣair veṣair mater ativimohakaraṃ pralobham // /
analyzed: śrīmat su śāntam amalam bhagavat praṇītam yat śraddhayā kali janāḥ api yānti śāntim  buddha avatāram adhigamya kalau alakṣaiḥ veṣaiḥ mateḥ ati vimoha karam pralobham
translated: The glorious, peaceful, and pure doctrine taught by the Blessed One, by which even people of the Kali age attain peace through faith,🔽Having attained the state of a Buddha, the Blessed One, the son of the Jina, in Gaya, will create a great delusion for the minds of people through various arts and costumes,

original: pākhaṇḍaśāstram adhikalpya suradviṣāṇāṃ kartā jinasya tanayo bhagavān gayāyām /
analyzed: pākhaṇḍa śāstram adhikalpya sura dviṣāṇām kartā jinasya tanayaḥ bhagavān gayāyām
translated: Deluding the multitude of gods and demons with heretical scriptures,

original: pākhaṇḍaśāstrabahule nijavedamārge naṣṭe dvijātibhir asatpathi vartamāne // /
analyzed: pākhaṇḍa śāstra bahule nija veda mārge naṣṭe dvijātibhiḥ asat pathi vartamāne
translated: When the path of one's own Vedas, full of heretical scriptures, is lost, and the twice-born are following an evil path,

analyzed: kalkya avatāra taraṇiḥ taruṇa andhakāra tulyam tudan nṛpa gaṇam kṛta dharma goptā
translated: The protector of the Dharma, the sun of the Kalki incarnation, striking the multitude of kings like the darkness of youth,

original: sākṣād bhaviṣyati sarasvatisaṃjñitāyāṃ śrīsārvabhauma iti vedagupo dvijāgryāt // /
analyzed: sākṣāt bhaviṣyati sarasvati saṃjñitāyām śrī sārvabhaumaḥ iti dvijāgryāt
translated: Will appear in person in the land called Sarasvati, as the foremost of Brahmins, known as Shri Sarvabhauma, the protector of the Vedas.

original: kṛtvā puraṃdaraśriyaṃ balaye 'tidāsyan goptāṣṭame manuyuge viditānubhāvaḥ /
